Article title: Chief Executive of Hong Kong SAR, Carrie Lam, Strongly Condemns the Violent Attack and Destruction of the Legislative Council.

Article text: In the early hours of 2 July, the Hong Kong Chief Executive, Carrie Lam, said that she felt strong resentment and sadness at the extremely violent way in which some protesters stormed the Legislative Council on 1 July and that she strongly condemned it. The Hong Kong SAR government will undoubtedly prosecute any illegal act to the end.

Some radicals in Hong Kong violently stormed and occupied the Legislative Council on the evening of the July 1st, and completely recklessly smashed wreaked havoc on the facilities in the Legislative Council chamber. Hong Kong police moved in and cleared the area after midnight, driving out the protesters who had violently stormed and occupied the LegCo building. 

During a media briefing around 4 am on July 2, Carrie Lam said that some protesters had been confronting police since the morning of the 1st, blocking roads and attacking police officers with unknown liquids. At noon, the situation took a sharp turn for the worse, with protesters storming the Legislative Council building in an extremely violent manner, using iron bars and shopping carts to smash the glass facade, and bringing toxic chemical powder to attack police. In the evening, the protesters entered the Legislative Council building and recklessly trashed it, destroying the highly revered Chamber and the Hong Kong SAR emblem.

Carrie Lam said that these lawless acts of violence have seriously disrupted the core value of the rule of law in Hong Kong. She was outraged and saddened by this, and strongly condemned it, and believed that the public shared these feelings.

She said the police had shown restraint in dealing with the violence throughout the day, but any violations of the law will definitely be pursued to the end.
